Justification: Emily is 13 months old and has a fever of 101.3°F (38.5°C). Febrile seizures are the most common type of seizure in children this age.
Meningitis can cause seizures, especially in young children. Emily's fever and recent upper respiratory infection could be suggestive of meningitis.
Encephalitis is an inflammation of the brain that can cause seizures.  Emily's fever and recent upper respiratory infection could be suggestive of encephalitis.
